item.title: EMM add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: EMM add a quote by Chris Guillebeau
item.description: "You don’t have to live your life the way other people expect you to." -- Chris Guillebeau

item.title: EMM add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: EMM add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived." -- Harper Lee

item.title: EMM add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "There are just some kind of men…who’re so busy worrying about the next world they’ve never learned to live in this one." -- Harper Lee

item.title: EMM add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: EMM add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: EMM add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Where are the people?” resumed the little prince at last. “It’s a little lonely in the desert…” “It is lonely when you’re among people, too,” said the snake." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: EMM add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Then something Tookish woke up inside him, and he wished to go and see the great mountains, and hear the pine-trees and the waterfalls, and explore the caves, and wear a sword instead of a walking-stick." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: EMM add a quote by Jared Diamond
item.description: "In contrast [to trees and fish], oil, metals, and coal are not renewable; they don't reproduce, sprout, or have sex to produce baby oil droplets or coal nuggets." -- Jared Diamond
